instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840 doesn't see the camera.
threads.message:
The MacBook is fully functional and works except for the camera. There is no picture, but the devices have it. The green indicator is flashing but there is no picture. I connected other displays, same thing!
[ATTACH type="full"]61469[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840 doesn't see the camera.
threads.message:
Camera flex also suffers by flexgate...
ALS works?

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840 doesn't see the camera.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 103896, member: 682"]
Camera flex also suffers by flexgate...
[/QUOTE]
This is not a problem with a flexible cable since I installed another display module from another MacBook and still does not see the camera. 
[QUOTE]
ALS
[/QUOTE]
What is this ?

threads.title: Macbook A1708 820-00840 doesn't see the camera.
threads.message:
Ambient Light Sensor, placed in same module as camera...

Check L4007/09/10 and L4080/1/2/4/5.
Do you get 5V_S0_ALSCAM_F?
